wikipedia_page.main: Gertrude Baillie-Weaver born Gertrude Renton published as Gertrude Colmore (8 June 1855 – 26 November 1926) was a writer and suffragist. She co-founded the National Council for Animals' Welfare and wrote in support of animal and human rights. Her books about Suffragette Sally and Emily Wilding Davison were republished in the 1980s.
